bioghist.p: Clarence S. Brigham (1877-1963) was a librarian, historian, and bibliographer. He was the librarian of the American Antiquarian Society from 1908 to 1930. He was appointed director of the Society in 1930, and served as its president from 1954 to 1959. In 1913 he began publishing in the Proceedings his state-by-state lists that would finally be published in 1947 as the History and Bibliography of American Newspapers, 1690-1820, and in 1954 he published Paul Revere's Engravings.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook from a trip to Cuba taken by Clarence Brigham and Elizabeth Brigham in 1933. Items include passenger lists, postcards, snapshots, meal tickets, jai-alai and horse racing programs, and menus and wine lists. The scrapbook also includes mementoes from another trip Brigham took to Cuba in 1938.
